snippet: A New York City baseball fan has spent six years traveling with a faded ball, hoping to pay homage to all the inductees of the Baseball Hall of Fame, living and dead....
abstract: Baseball fan Ralph Carhart is working on photography project that he hopes will be accepted into National Baseball Hall of Fame; aims to connect all 312 Baseball Hall of Fame members--both living and deceased--by putting same baseball in hand of every living member and visiting grave of every deceased member, and taking commemorative photograph.
lead_paragraph: A New York City baseball fan has spent six years traveling with a faded ball, hoping to pay homage to all the inductees of the Baseball Hall of Fame, living and dead.

headline.main: With a Single Baseball, Seeking to Connect All 312 Hall of Famers
headline.print_headline: From Cemeteries to a Cryonics Lab,  a Mission to Connect Baseball Greats
